intro: Cadetia ledifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are tubular with five lobes. Cadetia ledifolia is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
